data.chText: 使（重病患者）康复；使（长期服刑者）恢复正常生活
data.enText: to help sb to have a normal, useful life again after they have been very ill/sick or in prison for a long time

data.chText: 帮助吸毒者恢复正常生活的机构
data.enText: a unit for rehabilitating drug addicts

data.chText: 恢复…的名誉；给…平反昭雪
data.enText: to begin to consider that sb is good or acceptable after a long period during which they were considered bad or unacceptable

data.chText: 他对恢复玛格里特艺术家的名誉起了重要的作用。
data.enText: He played a major role in rehabilitating Magritte as an artist.

data.chText: 使（建筑物或地区）恢复原状；修复
data.enText: to return a building or an area to its previous good condition
the rehabilitation of the steel industry

simple_means.memory_skill: re 重新 + habilitate 装备；使具备能力 → 重新获得能力 → 使康复

means: 使(长期服刑者)恢复正常生活
使(建筑物或地区)恢复原状

tr: help to readapt, as to a former state of health or good repute
example: After a year in the mental clinic, the patient is now rehabilitated

tr: restore to a state of good condition or operation

example: Deng Xiao Ping was rehabilitated several times throughout his lifetime

value.def: To rehabilitate someone who has been ill or in prison means to help them to live a normal life again. To rehabilitate someone who has a drug or alcohol problem means to help them stop using drugs or alcohol.

example.ex: Considerable efforts have been made to rehabilitate patients who have suffered in this way.
example.tran: 为帮助遭受这种病痛折磨的病人康复付出了巨大努力。

value.tran: 使康复;使戒毒(或戒酒);改造(罪犯)

value.def: If someone is rehabilitated, they begin to be considered acceptable again after a period during which they have been rejected or severely criticized.

example.ex: Ten years later, Dreyfus was rehabilitated...
example.tran: 10年之后，德雷福斯的冤情得以昭雪。

example.ex: His candidacy has divided the party; while most have scorned him, others have sought to rehabilitate him.
example.tran: 他的候选资格使该党出现分化;其中大多数人都嘲弄他，而另外一些人则想办法为他恢复名誉。

value.tran: 使恢复名誉;给…平反昭雪

example.ex: The party has taken an important step towards the rehabilitation of the disgraced MP.
example.tran: 该党朝着为这位蒙羞的议员恢复名誉迈出了重要的一步。

value.def: To rehabilitate a building or an area means to improve its condition so that it can be used again.

example.tran: 对低收入者的住房进行整修的项目

value.tran: 复原，修葺，整修，修复(建筑物或某区域)

example.ex: Money will be directed primarily towards the maintenance and rehabilitation of schools, clinics and machinery.
example.tran: 资金将主要用于学校、诊所和机器设备的维护和修缮。

partsOfSpeech.dec: abil 能 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 能力
de 去掉 + bility〔=ability〕能力 → 使能力失掉 → 虚弱
de 去掉 + bilit〔= abili〕能 + ate 做，造成，使… → 去掉能力 → 使衰弱
habilit〔= abili〕能 + ate 做，造成，使… → 装备；使具备能力
re 重新 + habilitate 装备；使具备能力 → 重新获得能力 → 使康复
